sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"群，帮，伙"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: group, crowd, gang, band, mob, throng, masses, swarm
means: group ： 普通用词，通常指有组织、有秩序的一群人，也可指无意汇集在一起的一群人。
crowd ： 常指无组织地乱哄哄地挤在一起的人群。
gang ： 常指从事非法、暴力或敌对活动的帮派或团伙。有时呈中性，词义同group。
band ： 多指一群有明确宗旨，为共同目的而结合在一起的人，常含贬义。
mob ： 指无组织、乱七八糟凑合在一起的乌合之众，或指聚集在一起寻衅滋事的人群，多为暴徒。
throug ： 书面用词，意义接近crowd，侧重密集地挤在一起的一群，含挤在一起向前推进之意。
masses ： 指群众或人民大众。
swarm ： 指人数众多，杂乱无章，不停移动的一群人。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"人们，人群"之意。
means: people ： 最普通用词，不带任何色彩，泛指不确定数量的人们。
masses ： 指群众或平民，在西方国家含贬义，在我国含褒义。
crowd ： 本义指一大群紧紧聚集在一起的人群，现指群众整体，由个体结合的人群或大众。
through与crowd含义很接近，常可换用，但侧重指向前运动的群众。
mob ： 含贬义，指乌合之众、暴民。

sentence.Network_en: They throng the beaches between late June and early August.
sentence.Network_cn: 6月底到8月初，他们群聚在海滩上。

sentence.Network_en: An official pushed through the throng.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名官员费力地挤过人群。

sentence.Network_en: We pushed our way through the throng.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Esp词汇资料 ... uzata por pesi 称 )希腊根 ↓ throng 群集." ->" soldiers generally 一般地" 6.
人字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 人权〖 humanrights〗 人群〖 crowd;throng〗 人儿〖 figurine〗.
新概念第四册单词总汇[旺旺英语论坛] ... furlong 弗隆(合1/8英里) throng 挤满 bog 陷入泥沼.
GRE词汇精选（核心词汇） ... throne 宝座；王位 throng 一大群；v.拥挤 throwback 返祖现象，复旧.

list.abs: I disentangled myself from the merry throng ., 我由那欢乐的人群中脱身而去.
I disentangled myself from the merry throng ., 我由那欢乐的人群中脱身而去.
but as he went the people thronged him .耶稣去的时候，众人拥挤他。
I try to avoid the thronged streets and stores just before Christmas ., 在圣诞节之前 , 我都尽量避开拥挤的街道和商店.
The audience thronged into the theatre ., 观众拥进了剧场.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (ge)thrang 'crowd, tumult', of Germanic origin. The early sense of the verb (Middle English) was 'press violently, force one's way'

entry.def: A throng is a large crowd of people.

example.ex: An official pushed through the throng.
example.tran: 一名官员费力地挤过人群。

entry.def: When people throng somewhere, they go there in great numbers.

example.ex: The crowds thronged into the mall.
...the multitudes that throng around the Pope.
example.tran: 拥在教皇周围的教众甚多

entry.def: If people throng a place, they are present there in great numbers.

example.ex: They throng the beaches between late June and early August.
example.tran: 6 月底到 8 月初，他们群聚在海滩上。

auth_sentence.content: The street was as throng as on a market day.
auth_sentence.res_content: The street was as throng as on a market day.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The street was as throng as on a market day.

auth_sentence.content: It was quiet without the usual throng of browsing tourists.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was quiet without the usual throng of browsing tourists.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was quiet without the usual throng of browsing tourists.

auth_sentence.content: The pent-up breath of an unsav'ry throng.
auth_sentence.res_content: The pent-up breath of an unsav'ry throng.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The pent-up breath of an unsav'ry throng.

sentences.en: A patient throng was waiting in silence.
sentences.cn: 一大群耐心的人在静静地等着。
吊唁者蜂拥着前来参加葬礼。

jushi.english: A patient throng was waiting in silence.
jushi.chinese: 一大群耐心的人在静静地等着。
吊唁者蜂拥着前来参加葬礼。

jushi.english: The protesters thronged major streets of the city.
jushi.chinese: 这个城市的主要街道挤满了抗议者。
